data.name: سُورَةُ الشُّعَرَاءِ
data.englishBism: In the name of God, The Most Gracious, The Dispenser of Grace

ayahs.englishText: Ta. Sin, Mim.
THESE ARE MESSAGES of the divine writ, clear in itself and clearly showing the truth!
Wouldst thou, perhaps, torment thyself to death [with grief] because they [who live around thee] refuse to believe [in it]?
ayahs.arabicText: لَعَلَّكَ بَاخِعٌ نَفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Had We so willed, We could have sent down unto them a message from the skies, so that their necks would [be forced to] bow down before it in humility.
ayahs.arabicText: إِنْ نَشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِمْ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ آيَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَاقُهُمْ لَهَا خَاضِعِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [But We have not willed it:] and so, whenever there comes unto them any fresh reminder from the Most Gracious, they [who are blind of heart] always - turn their backs upon it:
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ ذِكْرٍ مِنَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ

ayahs.englishText: thus, indeed, have they given the lie (to this message as well). But [in time] they will come to understand what it was that they were wont to deride!
ayahs.arabicText: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنْبَاءُ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Have they, then, never considered the earth - how much of every noble kind [of life] We have caused to grow thereon?
ayahs.arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِنْ كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: In this, behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: But, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone - is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
HENCE, [remember how it was] when thy Sustainer summoned Moses: “Go unto those evil doing people.
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ ائْتِ الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: the people of Pharaoh, who refuse to be con­scious of Me!”
He answered: “O my Sustainer! Behold, I fear that they will give me the lie,
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَنْ يُكَذِّبُونِ

ayahs.englishText: and then my breast will be straitened and my tongue will not be free: send, then, [this Thy command] to Aaron.
ayahs.arabicText: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِي وَلَا يَنْطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَارُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Moreover, they keep a grave charge [pending] against me, and I fear that they will slay me.”
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَهُمْ عَلَيَّ ذَنْبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَنْ يَقْتُلُونِ

ayahs.englishText: Said He: “Not so, indeed! Go forth, then, both of you, with Our messages: verify, We shall be with you, listening [to your call]!
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَاذْهَبَا بِآيَاتِنَا ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُمْ مُسْتَمِعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And go, both of you, unto Pharaoh and say, ‘Behold, we bear a message from the Sustainer of all the worlds:
ayahs.arabicText: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَا إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Let the children of Israel go with us!’”
[But when Moses had delivered his message, Pharaoh] said: “Did we not bring thee up among us when thou wert a child? And didst thou not spend among us years of thy [later] life?
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And yet thou didst commit that [heinous] deed of thine, and [hast thus shown that] thou art one of the ingrate!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ الَّتِي فَعَلْتَ وَأَنْتَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Replied [Moses]: “I committed it while I was still going astray;
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَا إِذًا وَأَنَا مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ

ayahs.englishText: and I fled from you because I feared you. But [since] then my Sustainer has endowed me with the ability to judge [between right and wrong], and has made me one of [His] message-­bearers.
ayahs.arabicText: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنْكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And [as for] that favour of which thou so tauntingly remindest me - [was it not] due to thy having enslaved the children of Israel?”
ayahs.arabicText: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنْ عَبَّدْتَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ

ayahs.englishText: Said Pharaoh: “And what [and who] is that ‘Sustainer of all the worlds’?”
[Moses] answered: “[He is] the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them: if you would but [allow yourselves to] be convinced!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُوقِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Said [Pharaoh] unto those around him: “Did you hear [what he said]?”
[And Moses] continued: “[He is] your Sus­tainer, [too,] as well as the Sustainer of your fore­fathers of old!”
[Pharaoh] exclaimed: “Behold, [this] your ‘apostle’ who [claims that he] has been sent unto you is mad indeed!
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ الَّذِي أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ

ayahs.englishText: [But Moses] went on: “[He of whom I speak is] the Sustainer of the east and the west and of all that is between the two”- as you would know] if you would but use your reason!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Said [Pharaoh]: “Indeed, if thou choose to worship any deity other than me, I shall most cer­tainly throw thee into prison!
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ لَئِنِ اتَّخَذْتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيْرِي لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ الْمَسْجُونِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Said he: “Even if I should bring about before thee something that clearly shows the truth?”
[Pharaoh] answered: “Produce it, then, if thou art a man of truth!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Thereupon [Moses] threw down his staff - and lo! it was a serpent, plainly visible;
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُبِينٌ

ayahs.englishText: and he drew forth his hand - and lo! it appeared [shining] white to the beholders.
ayahs.arabicText: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيْضَاءُ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Said [pharaoh] unto the great ones around him: “Verily, this is indeed a sorcerer of great knowledge
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَاحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ

ayahs.englishText: who wants to drive you out of your land by his sorcery. What, then, do you advise?”
ayahs.arabicText: يُرِيدُ أَنْ يُخْرِجَكُمْ مِنْ أَرْضِكُمْ بِسِحْرِهِ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: They answered: “Let him and his brother wait a while, and send unto all cities heralds
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَابْعَثْ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: who shall assemble before thee all sorcerers of great knowl­edge”
And so the sorcerers were assembled at a set time on a certain day,
and the people were asked: Are you all present,
so that we might follow [in the footsteps of] the sorcerers if it is they who prevail?”
ayahs.arabicText: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ السَّحَرَةَ إِنْ كَانُوا هُمُ الْغَالِبِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Now when the sorcerers came, they said unto Pharaoh: “Verily, we ought to have a great reward if it is we who prevail.
ayahs.arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِنْ كُنَّا نَحْنُ الْغَالِبِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Answered he: “Yea - and, verily, in that case you shall be among those who are near unto me.
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَمِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [And] Moses said unto them: “Throw whatever you are going to throw!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ لَهُمْ مُوسَىٰ أَلْقُوا مَا أَنْتُمْ مُلْقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Thereupon they threw their [magic ropes and their staffs, and said: “By Pharaoh’s might, behold, it is we indeed who have prevailed!”
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَلْقَوْا حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الْغَالِبُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [But] then Moses threw his staff - and lo! it swallowed up all their deceptions.
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And down fell the sorcerers, prostrating them­selves in adoration,
[and] exclaimed: “We have come to believe in the Sustainer of all the worlds,
the Sustainer of Moses and Aaron!”

Said [Pharaoh]: “Have you come to believe in him ere I have given you permission? Verily, he must be your master who has taught you magic! But in time you shall come to know [my revenge]: most certainly shall I cut off your hands and your feet in great numbers, because of [your] perverseness, and shall most certainly crucify you in great numbers, all together!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ آمَنْتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ الَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُمْ مِنْ خِلَافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

ayahs.englishText: They answered: “No harm [canst thou do to us]: verily, unto our Sustainer do we turn!
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنْقَلِبُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Behold, we [but] ardently desire that our Sustainer forgive us our faults in return for our having been foremost among the believers!”
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَنْ يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَايَانَا أَنْ كُنَّا أَوَّلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: AND [there came a time when] We inspired Moses thus: “Go forth with My servants by night: for, behold, you will he pursued!”
ayahs.arabicText: ۞ وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي إِنَّكُمْ مُتَّبَعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And Pharaoh sent heralds unto all cities,
[bidding them to call out his troops and to proclaim:] “Behold, these [children of Israel] are but a contemptible band;
but they are indeed filled with hatred of us
seeing that we are, verily, a nation united, fully prepared against danger –
and so we have [rightly] driven them out of [their] gardens and springs,
and [deprived them of their erstwhile] station of honour!”
Thus it was: but [in the course of time] We were to bestow all these [things] as a heritage on the children of Israel.
And so [the Egyptians] caught up with them at sunrise;
and as soon as the two hosts came in sight of one another, the followers of Moses exclaimed: “Behold, we shall certainly be overtaken [and defeated]!”
ayahs.arabicText: فَلَمَّا تَرَاءَى الْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَابُ مُوسَىٰ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ

ayahs.englishText: He replied: Nay indeed! My Sustainer is with me, [and] He will guide me!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ

ayahs.englishText: Thereupon We inspired Moses thus: Strike the sea with thy staff!”- whereupon it parted, and each part appeared like a mountain vast.
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ اضْرِبْ بِعَصَاكَ الْبَحْرَ ۖ فَانْفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَالطَّوْدِ الْعَظِيمِ

ayahs.englishText: And We caused the pursuers to draw near unto that place:
and We saved Moses and all who were with him,
and then We caused the others to drown.
In this [story] behold, there is a message [unto all men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And yet, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone - is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
And convey unto them the story of Abraham –
[how it was] when he asked his father and his people, “What is it that you worship?”
ayahs.arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ

ayahs.englishText: They answered: We worship idols, and we remain ever devoted to them.”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَاكِفِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Said he: “Do [you really think that] they hear you when you invoke them,
or benefit you or do you harm?”
They exclaimed: But we found our fore­fathers doing the same!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا بَلْ وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Said [Abraham]: “Have you, then, ever con­sidered what it is that you have been worshipping
you and those ancient forebears of yours?
“Now [as for me, I know that,] verily, these [false deities] are my enemies, [and that none is my helper] save the Sustainer of all the worlds,
ayahs.arabicText: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِي إِلَّا رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: who has created me and is the One who guides me,
and is the One who gives me to eat and to drink,
and when I fall ill, is the One who restores me to health,
and who will cause me to die and then will bring me back to life –
and who, [hope, will forgive me my faults on Judgment Day!
ayahs.arabicText: وَالَّذِي أَطْمَعُ أَنْ يَغْفِرَ لِي خَطِيئَتِي يَوْمَ الدِّينِ

ayahs.englishText: “O my Sustainer! Endow me with the ability to judge [between right and wrong], and make me one with the righteous,
ayahs.arabicText: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالصَّالِحِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and grant me the power to convey the truth unto those who will come after me,
ayahs.arabicText: وَاجْعَلْ لِي لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِي الْآخِرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and place me among those who shall inherit the garden of bliss!
“And forgive my father - for, verily, he is among those who have gone astray –
ayahs.arabicText: وَاغْفِرْ لِأَبِي إِنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ

ayahs.englishText: and do not put me to shame on the Day when all shall be raised from the dead:
the Day on which neither wealth will be of any use, nor children,
ayahs.arabicText: يَوْمَ لَا يَنْفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [and when] only he [will be happy] who comes before God with a heart free of evil!”
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى اللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: For, [on that Day,] paradise will be brought within sight of the God-conscious,
whereas the blazing fire will be laid open before those who had been lost in grievous error;
and they will be asked: “Where now is all that you were wont to worship
ayahs.arabicText: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ

ayahs.englishText: instead of God? Can these [things and beings] be of any help to you or to themselves?”
ayahs.arabicText: مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ هَلْ يَنْصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنْتَصِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Thereupon they will be hurled into hell – they, as well as all [others] who had been lost in grievous error,
and the hosts of Iblis - all together.
And there and then, blaming one another, they [who had grievously sinned in life] will exclaim:
“By God, we were most obviously astray
ayahs.arabicText: تَاللَّهِ إِنْ كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: when we deemed you [false deities] equal to the Sustainer of all the worlds –
yet they who have seduced us [into believing in you] are the truly guilty ones!
And now we have none to intercede for us,
nor any loving friend.
Would that we had a second chance [in life], so that we could be among the believers!”
ayahs.arabicText: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: In all this, behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: But, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone - is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
The people of Noah [too] gave the lie to [one of God’s] message-bearers
when their brother Noah said unto them: “Will you not be conscious of God?
ayahs.arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore] worthy of your trust:
be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!
“And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Hence, remain conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!”
They answered: “Shall we place our faith in thee, even though [only] the most abject [of people] follow thee?”
Said he: “And what knowledge could I have as to what they were doing [before they came to me]?
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِي بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Their reckoning rests with none but my Sus­tainer: if you could but understand [this]!
ayahs.arabicText: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّي ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Hence, I shall not drive away [any of] those [who profess to be] believers;
I am nothing but a plain warner.”
Said they: “Indeed, if thou desist not, O Noah, thou wilt surely be stoned to death!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا لَئِنْ لَمْ تَنْتَهِ يَا نُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمَرْجُومِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [Whereupon] he prayed: “O my Sustainer! Behold, my people have given me the lie:
hence, lay Thou wide open the truth between me and them, and save me and those of the believers who are with me!”
ayahs.arabicText: فَافْتَحْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَنْ مَعِيَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And so We saved him and those [who were] with him in the fully-laden ark,
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَنْجَيْنَاهُ وَمَنْ مَعَهُ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ

ayahs.englishText: and then We caused those who stayed behind to drown.
In this [story], behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: But, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone - is almighty, a dispenser of grace
[AND the tribe of] Ad gave the lie to [one of God’s] message-bearers
when their brother Hud said unto them: “Will you not be conscious of God?
ayahs.arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore] worthy of your trust:
be, then, con­scious of God, and pay heed unto me!
“And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: “Will you, in your wanton folly, build [idola­trous] altars on every height,
and make for yourselves mighty castles, [hoping] that you might become immortal?
And will you [always], whenever you lay hand [on others], lay hand [on them] cruelly, without any restraint?
“Be, then, conscious of God and pay heed unto me:
and [thus] be conscious of Him who has [so] amply provided you with all [the good] that you might think of
amply provided you with flocks, and children,
and gardens, and springs -:
for, verily, I fear lest suffering befall you on an awesome day!”
ayahs.arabicText: إِنِّي أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: [But] they answered. “It is all one to us whether thou preachest [something new] or art not of those who [like to] preach.
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْنَا أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُنْ مِنَ الْوَاعِظِينَ

ayahs.englishText: This [religion of ours] is none other than that to which our forebears clung,
and we are not going to be chastised [for adhering to it]!”
And so they gave him the lie: and thereupon We destroyed them. In this [story], behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
ayahs.arabicText: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: But, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone - is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
[AND the tribe of] Thamud gave the lie to [one of God’s] message-hearers
when their brother Salih said unto them: “Will you not be conscious of God?
ayahs.arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَالِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore] worthy of your trust:
be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!
“And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: “Do you think that you will be left secure [forever] in the midst of what you have here and now?
amidst [these] gardens and springs
and fields, and [these] palm-trees with slender spathes? –
and that you will [always be able to] hew dwellings out of the mountains with [the same] great skill?”
“Be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me,
and pay no heed to the counsel of those who are given to excesses –
those who spread corruption on earth instead of setting things to rights!”
ayahs.arabicText: الَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Said they: “Thou art but one of the be­witched!
Thou art nothing but a mortal like our­selves! Come, then, forward with a token [of thy mission] if thou art a man of truth!”
ayahs.arabicText: مَا أَنْتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِآيَةٍ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Replied he: “This she-camel shall have a share of water, and you shall have a share of water, on the days appointed [therefor];
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ هَٰذِهِ نَاقَةٌ لَهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَعْلُومٍ

ayahs.englishText: and do her no harm, lest suffering befall you on an awesome day!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: But they cruelly slaughtered her - and then they had cause to regret it:
for the suffering [predicted by Salih,] befell them [then and there]. In this [story], behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَخَذَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: But, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone – is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
[AND] the people of Lot gave the lie to [one of God’s] message-bearers
when their brother Lot said unto them: “Will you not be conscious of God?
ayahs.arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore] worthy of your trust:
be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!
“And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: “Must you, of all people, [lustfully] approach men,
keeping yourselves aloof from all the [lawful] spouses whom your Sustainer has created for you? Nay, but you are people who transgress all bounds of what is right!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ مِنْ أَزْوَاجِكُمْ ۚ بَلْ أَنْتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Said they: “Indeed, If thou desist not, O Lot, thou wilt most certainly be expelled [from this town­ship]!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا لَئِنْ لَمْ تَنْتَهِ يَا لُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمُخْرَجِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [Lot] exclaimed: “Behold, I am one of those who utterly abhor your doings!”
[And then he prayed:] “O my Sustainer! Save me and my household from all that they are doing!”
Thereupon We saved him and all his household –
all but an old woman, who was among those that stayed behind;
and then We utterly destroyed the others,
and rained down upon them a rain [of destruction]: and dire is such rain upon all who let themselves be warned [to no avail]!
ayahs.arabicText: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ مَطَرًا ۖ فَسَاءَ مَطَرُ الْمُنْذَرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: In this [story], behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not be­lieve [in it].
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: But, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone - is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
[AND] the dwellers of the wooded dales [of Madyan] gave the lie to [one of God’s] message-bearers
when their brother Shu’ayb said unto them: “Will you not be conscious of God?
ayahs.arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore] worthy of your trust:
be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!
“And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: “[Always] give full measure, and be not among those who [unjustly] cause loss [to others];
ayahs.arabicText: ۞ أَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا مِنَ الْمُخْسِرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and [in all your dealings] weigh with a true balance,
and do not deprive people of what is rightfully theirs; and do not act wickedly on earth by spreading corruption,
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا النَّاسَ أَشْيَاءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا فِي الْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ

ayahs.englishText: but be conscious of Him who has created you, just as [He created] those countless generations of old!”
Said they: “Thou art but one of the be­witched,
for thou art nothing but a mortal like ourselves! And, behold, we think that thou art a consummate liar!
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا أَنْتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُنَا وَإِنْ نَظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Cause, then, fragments of the sky to fall down upon us, if thou art a man of truth!”
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Answered [Shu’ayb]: “My Sustainer knows fully well what you are doing.”
But they gave him the lie. And thereupon suffering overtook them on a day dark with shadows: and, verily, it was the suffering of an awesome day!
ayahs.arabicText: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ الظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: In this [story], behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most of them will not believe [in it].
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: But, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone - is almighty, a dispenser of grace!
Now, behold, this [divine writ] has indeed been bestowed from on high by the Sustainer of all the worlds:
trustworthy divine inspiration has alighted with it from on high
upon thy heart, [O Muhammad] so that thou mayest be among those who preach
in the clear Arabic tongue.
And, verily, [the essence of] this [revelation] is indeed found in the ancient books of divine wisdom [as well].
Is it not evidence enough for them that [so many] learned men from among the children of Israel have recognized this [as true]?
ayahs.arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُمْ آيَةً أَنْ يَعْلَمَهُ عُلَمَاءُ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ

ayahs.englishText: But [even] had We bestowed it from on high upon any of the non-Arabs,
and had he recited it unto them [in his own tongue], they would not have believed in it.
ayahs.arabicText: فَقَرَأَهُ عَلَيْهِمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ مُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Thus have We caused this [message] to pass [unheeded] through the hearts of those who are lost in sin:
they will not believe in it till they behold the grievous suffering
ayahs.arabicText: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ

ayahs.englishText: that will come upon them [on resurrection,] all of a sudden, without their being aware [of its approach];
and then they will exclaim, “Could we have a respite?”
Do they, then, [really] wish that Our chas­tisement be hastened on?
But hast thou ever considered [this]: If We do allow them to enjoy [this life] for some years,
and thereupon that [chastisement] which they were promised befalls them –
of what avail to them will be all their past enjoyments?
ayahs.arabicText: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُمْ مَا كَانُوا يُمَتَّعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And withal, never have We destroyed any community unless it had been warned
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنْذِرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and reminded: for, never do We wrong [anyone].
And [this divine writ is such a reminder:] no evil spirits have brought it down:
for, neither does it suit their ends, nor is it in their power [to impart it to man]:
verily, [even] from hearing it are they utterly debarred!
Hence, [O man,] do not invoke any other deity side by side with God, lest thou find thyself among those who are made to suffer [on Judgment Day].
ayahs.arabicText: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُعَذَّبِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And warn [whomever thou canst reach, beginning with] thy kinsfolk,
and spread the wings of thy tenderness over all of the believers who may follow thee;
ayahs.arabicText: وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: but if they disobey thee, say, “I am free of responsibility for aught that you may do!” –
ayahs.arabicText: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّي بَرِيءٌ مِمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and place thy trust in the Almighty, the Dispenser of Grace,
who sees thee when thou standest [alone],
and [sees] thy behaviour among those who prostrate themselves [before Him]:
for, verily, He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing!
[And] shall I tell you upon whom it is that those evil spirits descend?
ayahs.arabicText: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَنْ تَنَزَّلُ الشَّيَاطِينُ

ayahs.englishText: They descend upon all sinful self-deceivers
who readily lend ear [to every falsehood], and most of whom lie to others as well.
And as for the poets [they, too, are prone to deceive themselves: and so, only] those who are lost in grievous error would follow them.
Art thou not aware that they roam confusedly through all the valleys [of words and thoughts],
ayahs.arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِي كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and that they [so often] say what they do not do [or feel]?

[Most of them are of this kind] save those who have attained to faith, and do righteous deeds, and remember God unceasingly, and defend them­selves [only] after having been wronged, and [trust in God’s promise that] those who are bent on wrong­doing will in time come to know how evil a turn their destinies are bound to take!
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَذَكَرُوا اللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَانْتَصَرُوا مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا أَيَّ مُنْقَلَبٍ يَنْقَلِبُونَ
